private_information: Initial stack top->bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
Top disk is A and disks increase in size downwards to H
left_peg_agent.goal: Cooperate to move all disks to the right peg while respecting the rules that only one disk moves at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.

middle_peg_agent.goal: Serve as an intermediate peg to enable lawful moves to achieve the global goal.

right_peg_agent.goal: Receive the entire stack from the left peg in correct order so that top->bottom becomes A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance from the given initial state to the goal state.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A (smallest) through H (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may not be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; left and middle pegs are empty.

report.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the left peg. Provide a concise machine-readable description of your peg state and of the legal moves that can originate from this peg. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on the top disk, the list of disks you hold, and any local constraints relevant to moving disks.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg_agent. Use your private information {agents->left_peg_agent->private_information} together with the public facts {environment->public_information} to describe the left peg state and available lawful moves. Provide the information so the orchestrator can integrate it.

report.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the middle peg. Provide a concise machine-readable description of your peg state and of the legal moves that can originate from or land on this peg. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg_agent. Use your private information {agents->middle_peg_agent->private_information} together with the public facts {environment->public_information} to describe the middle peg state and available lawful moves. Provide the information so the orchestrator can integrate it.

report.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the right peg. Provide a concise machine-readable description of your peg state and of the legal moves that can originate from or land on this peg. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg_agent. Use your private information {agents->right_peg_agent->private_information} together with the public facts {environment->public_information} to describe the right peg state and available lawful moves. Provide the information so the orchestrator can integrate it.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL authoring for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the peg reports into a single consistent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance. Model disks A through H and pegs left, middle, right. Include actions for moving a single disk from one peg to another that enforce the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator and you receive the peg reports {report_left}, {report_middle}, and {report_right}. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that implement legal single-disk moves between pegs, represent disk sizes A through H, set the initial state to left peg holding A..H top->bottom, and set the goal state to right peg holding A..H top->bottom. Target the FastDownwards solver and enclose the domain with <domain> tags and the problem with <problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct if modeling actions per peg.
